td.p: The 10th GStreamer Conference will take place on Thursday and Friday 31 October - 1 November 2019 at L'Embarcadère in Lyon, France.
This is just after the Embedded Linux Conference Europe (ELCE), but not officially co-hosted with it and at a different venue in Lyon.
Click here for the conference schedule.

The GStreamer Conference is a conference for developers, community members, decision-makers, industry partners, researchers, students and anyone else interested in the GStreamer multimedia framework or Open Source and cross-platform multimedia.
Anyone interested in open source cross-platform multimedia is encouraged to join us at the GStreamer Conference 2019!

Whether you are a hobbyist, app developer, researcher or student interested in the field of multimedia, or working for a company that is using or looking to use GStreamer in their products, this is the perfect event for you to network at and to learn more about the latest technological developments and project news, and to meet developers as well as the wider community.
Registration is now open and will stay open until the conference.

b.a: Sign up for the GStreamer Conference here

td.p: There will be separate registration options for both professionals and for students and hobbyists:

tr.td: 500+ EUR (ca. 565 USD) (for those who want to give a little bit extra to the GStreamer project)

td.p: All tickets include lunch at the venue on both conference days as well as access to the social event on Thursday evening.

For those uncertain about whether to register as a professional or hobbyist, the general rule is that if your company pays for you or sponsors you, you are a professional, and if you personally pay you are a student or hobbyist. If in doubt drop us a mail or just register as hobbyist. The important thing is that you'll make it to the conference!

td.p: There will again be opportunities for short lightning talks for those who do not wish to present a full talk, but just want to showcase something they're working on, or present a problem or challenge they are facing or have solved, and that they think might be interesting for others to hear about.
Want to submit a ca. 5-minute mini-talk for our lightning talk/showcase event?
Simply send a quick mail to gstreamer-conference@lists.freedesktop.org above to reserve your slot (subject to availability).
There is no deadline for Lightning Talk submissions, slots will be allocated on a first-come first-serve basis.

The call for papers is now closed and talk proposals can no longer be submitted. Anyone who has submitted a talk proposal should have received an e-mail letting them know whether their proposal has been accepted.
Lightning talks may still be proposed.
Join us for some drinks and/or food at Ninkasi Guillotière (2 Place Antonin Jutard, 69003 Lyon) from 19.00h!
Food and drinks will be available for purchase, credit cards should be accepted.
There should be some tables reserved for us in our name. Note that there are multiple Ninkasi in Lyon, this is not the same as Thursday's one
td.h3: Thursday: Social Event with Food and Drinks at Ninkasi Saint-Paul
td.p: Ninkasi Saint Paul is located on 5 Rue Octavio Mey at the northern end of Lyon's historic Old Town district.
Note that there are multiple Ninkasi in Lyon, we'll be at the Saint Paul one.

How to get there from L'Embarcadère:
on foot: should be a nice walk, 30-35 minutes
by public transport: best to check Google Maps. Metro from Perrache to Hôtel de Ville - Louis Pradel (4 stops north) might save you some walking.
by Lime scooter: faster than on foot, probably!
by taxi/uber: should be a ca. 10 minute ride depending on traffic, perhaps 7-15 EUR or so
Please don't forget to bring your badge. (If you'd like to bring a +1 please get in touch, we may be able to arrange that.)

We will have two private areas at the venue - upstairs and downstairs, but part of the venue around the bar will be open to the public. There won't be a cloakroom where you can leave your jackets/bags and neither we nor the bar will take responsibility for any lost or damaged items, so you may want to drop off your gear at the hotel before you head there.

There are a few other events taking place alongside or just before the GStreamer Conference on 31 October / 1 November this year, so if you are making your way to Lyon you might want to consider combining the GStreamer Conference with some of the other events.
There will be a hackfest just after the conference, on Saturday and Sunday 2-3 November 2019. The hackfest will take place at Epitech, Lyon.

Please add yourself to the wiki page if you plan on attending the hackfest, so we have a rough idea of the number of people to expect. Mail Tim or Sebastian or pop onto the #gstreamer IRC channel if you don't have editing permissions for the wiki.
Everyone is welcome to attend, whether you added yourself to the list or not, so if you're around just pop in and say hello.
GStreamer hackfests are fairly informal, people mostly just sit around, drink coffee, discuss things, ask questions, and hack on whatever they feel like.
